page.title: 12Malmesbury GWR & L.S.Viaduct
page.content: The bed of the old{GWR}branch line called the {Kingsmead "Loop"}lies east of{Kingsmead Mill.}It joined the main Swindon to Bristol line with the Malmesbury branch line at Little Somerford Station from 1933 to 1951. The keeper's house,now owned by{David {Puttnam}and the crossing gates still exist.The 10km Malmesbury to Dauntsey line was opened in 1877 and closed in 1962.Now it's possible to walk part of the overgrown line which is a good habitat for wild life. South of Kingsmead Mill is {Little {Somerford Viaduct}of 13 arches which carry{Intercity 125}trains on the Swindon to South Wales line completed in 1903.Village women sold refreshments and home brewed beer to the navvies building the viaduct.Some navvies were injured or killed while it was being built.
